text: The United States Post Office is a historic building in Pawnee City, Nebraska. It was built in 1940–1941, and designed in the Classical Revival style by architect Louis A. Simon. With Inside, there is a mural by Kenneth Evett, completed in 1942. The building has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since May 11, 1992. ==References== Category:Post office buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Nebraska Category:National Register of Historic Places in Pawnee County, Nebraska Category:Colonial Revival architecture in Nebraska Category:Government buildings completed in 1942 Category:1942 establishments in Nebraska
title: United States Post Office (Pawnee City, Nebraska)
